body_html:
Because I am using a server remotely, several people use the server together. I only have chance now to access it.

To fix it , I fully deleted all. Then, after git pull latest code I did the following:

  1. conda create virtual environment for python 2.7 and install whole anaconda including scikit-learn.
  2. compile Tensorflow according to the tutorial steps.
    It works fine now. I tried mnist.py in skflow. All good.
body_text:
Because I am using a server remotely, several people use the server together. I only have chance now to access it.
To fix it , I fully deleted all. Then, after git pull latest code I did the following:

conda create virtual environment for python 2.7 and install whole anaconda including scikit-learn.
compile Tensorflow according to the tutorial steps.
It works fine now. I tried mnist.py in skflow.  All good.
body:
Because I am using a server remotely, several people use the server together. I only have chance now to access it. 

To fix it , I fully deleted all. Then, after git pull latest code I did the following:
1. conda create virtual environment for python 2.7 and install whole anaconda including scikit-learn.
2. compile Tensorflow according to the tutorial steps.
It works fine now. I tried mnist.py in skflow.  All good.
